meanings.definition: Thin or sparse in form or growth
meanings.sent1: The scraggly tree had only a few leaves left on its branches.
meanings.sent2: The garden had scraggly plants that struggled to grow in the dry soil.
meanings.sent3: The scraggly little plant looked like it needed a tiny haircut.
meanings.sent4: Her scraggly hair resembled a wild tangle of vines in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The scraggly bushes in the yard stood out against the lush greenery.

meanings.sent1: The scraggly dog wandered the streets looking for food.
meanings.sent2: His scraggly beard gave him a rugged and untamed look.
meanings.sent3: The scraggly cat seemed to have just woken up from a nap.
meanings.sent4: Her scraggly handwriting was barely legible on the crumpled paper.
meanings.sent5: The scraggly old scarecrow in the field scared away a few birds.
